cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles northwest of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northwest on Wednesday, then northwest through the Bahamas and parallel the southeast U.S. coast, approaching the Georgia/South Carolina coastline late Friday into Saturday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Georgia–South Carolina coast (close offshore encounter with coastal Georgia)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at this time (watches limited to Florida east coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None at this time (warnings limited to Florida east coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through Georgia to the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are possible by late Friday, with a 17% chance of sustained 50-kt (58-mph) winds; gusts could briefly reach hurricane force if the eye passes very near the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft of surge with large breaking waves possible along the Georgia barrier islands and tidal rivers if the center tracks just offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals, producing flash flooding in low-lying and urban areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents, possible coastal erosion, temporary channel shoaling, and river flooding from heavy upstream rainfall.
